remarks: Extend a line with a missing point.  Theorem 4.14 of [Schwabhauser] p. 37.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 27-Apr-2019.)
statement:
tglngval.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
tglngval.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
tglngval.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
tglngval.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
tglngval.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. P ) $.
tglngval.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. P ) $.
tgcolg.z $e |- ( ph -> Z e. P ) $.
lnxfr.r $e |- .~ = ( cgrG ` G ) $.
lnxfr.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. P ) $.
lnxfr.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. P ) $.
lnxfr.d $e |- .- = ( dist ` G ) $.
lnext.1 $e |- ( ph -> ( Y e. ( X L Z ) \/ X = Z ) ) $.
lnext.2 $e |- ( ph -> ( X .- Y ) = ( A .- B ) ) $.
lnext $p |- ( ph -> E. c e. P <" X Y Z "> .~ <" A B c "> ) $.
$d .- c $.
$d .~ c $.
$d A c $.
$d B c $.
$d I c $.
$d P c $.
$d X c $.
